Now i have a big pot of gravy with no beef in it, my question is can i just sear more beef chunks boil them in beef broth till tender and add that to my original gravy?

From Wiki:
On 21 February 2005, Beksiski was found dead in his flat in Warsaw with 17 stab wounds on his body; two of the wounds were determined to have been fatal. Robert Kupiec (the teenage son of his longtime caretaker), who later pleaded guilty, and a friend were arrested shortly after the crime. On 9 November 2006 Robert Kupiec was sentenced to 25 years in prison, and his accomplice, ukasz Kupiec, to 5 years by the court of Warsaw. Before his death, Beksiski refused to loan Robert Kupiec a few hundred zoty (approximately $100).

The lightest touch and you get stung, it feels a lot like a bee sting.
I once was digging for old bottles and i guess I barley touched some and ouch dude, I actually thought i was stung by bees and it takes like an hour to go away.

Old digger with a wealth of knowledge , I'd love to make a Vlog showing others how to find locations and dig for bottles.
I have a modest collection, As you get more advanced at digging what you take home and keep becomes less and less.
The digging community is very small and very tight knit community, I have met and talked to some of the old timers and I can tell you bottle digging is a dying art,however,if people knew how satisfying it is hopefully this awesome hobby could see a come back.
What I'd like to do is set up a mentor program where newbies are matched with experienced diggers so they have an opportunity to learn.
EG~ I could be a mentor for the lower part of NY and CT area's
I think digging is not something you should do alone it can be dangerous, further more it's hard to learn by yourself.
So what do you think of these ideas.
Good stuff!

WRITING.TITLE: I'd love to work with someone who can teach me some new techniques.
WRITING.TEXT:
I'd really like an opportunity to work with somebody who is a decent producer and who could take me under there wing and teach me some new techniques.
I know this is a long shot, I have 0 professional training and I also can't read notes.
Anyway I'm open to learning, so far all my experiments are hammered out in real time with a MicroKorg and Audasity that's it.
Here are my experiments, The first 2 tracks where made with a producer, I really learned a lot from him. https://soundcloud.com/user-345283577
I'm up for a challenge.

Audacity can do multiple stems etc, It sucks for fine edits,however, it records great in real time.
I guess what i need is a very robust .wav editor.

I think this is a great way to educate people about North Korea, I half heartily clicked on this thinking it was just going to be about how foreigners view American food,however....

You should bait them....I'm willing to help.
I think I know what there up too, it all starts when someone gives you a realistic-looking check or money order and asks you to send cash somewhere in return. It's phony, and so is the person's story, but that may take weeks to discover. Now your bank wants the money back. However, just because you can get the cash doesn't mean the check or money order is good. Ultimately, you are responsible for the checks or money orders you deposit or cash. That's how the scam works. EG~ below
* The receiving of packages containing payments to my employees(your fake check)
* Dispatching letters to my employees via 1st class mail(sending the money from the cashed fake check)
Here is the article that explains what happened here.... http://www.grindtv.com/wildlife/bizarre-wall-frozen-fish-makes-easy-meals-bald-eagles/#7hK230UDzMf8kJm1.97
This could be a whole new category!

In a post apocalyptic world a well dressed man is grocery shopping with a flashlight in a bombed out supermarket.(scene 1)
Whilst He exits the store you see the backdrop, bombed tattered remains of a once great city(scene 2)
Loading the canned goods into the side satchels of his motorcycle he suddenly freezes when he hears the sound of children playing echoing off in the distance.(scene 3)
He quickly starts his bike and races off to find the source of the noise.(scene 4)
After a few minutes he finds the source, children are outside playing in a bombed out playground and tears begin to stream from his eyes.(scene 5)
He parks the bike and sits down on a park bench to watch the kids play...he begins to laugh hysterically tears streaming from his eyes.(scene 6)
As he watches the kids play he reaches into his pocket and take out a pill bottle opens it into his palm and tape on the bottle it's empty(scene 7)
He drops the bottke to the grounds and it reads "Aripiprazole 2 reffils left) (scene 8)
We now see him laughing hysterically as the children play in the background (scene 9)
The final scene we see him again all alone laughing next to a bombed out playground laughing....nobody was ever there it was all in his head before the world came to end he being it's only survivor, our character had severe Schizophrenia. The story could be called "off my meds"

Now onto an unpopular opinion, I don't think a Scotch review can be accurately done by trying a Dram, I find myself drinking at least half a bottle before i'm ready to talk about it.
Scotch to me is like a good book it gets more interesting as you get deeper into it.
Cutty Sark and Glenlivet 12 are garbage hows that for a unpopular opinion.
I haven't had the privilege of trying their single casks.

"Sit on the floor a lot when you are in the same room as him" This is what I would do and when hew approaches look at him and then look away and down this will show him your non aggressive.
I also agree with pyrfostermom76 not to touch his head, if he came from an abusive place stay away from the head until mutual trust is obtained.
Every time you see him tell him how good he is using soft tones and if you can get him on a leash and walk with him for an hour or so a day he will love you very quickly.
I'm also sorry to hear that Harry came from an abusive home, It pisses me off to think your dog or any dogs are abused.

Yup it breaks my heart, I buried Pauly in my backyard around the same time, planted a lilac bush.
The good news is Pauly made it to 19 you can't ask for more.
I'm not religious or anything but I love that poem called the rainbow bridge if there is a heaven i wouldn't want to be there without my dogs.

My intention was to get a newfie, looking through adoption ads i discovered Effie so on a whim I went to the adoption place.....When I arrived the women in charge brought him out.
Effie was very sad and broken, he came right up to me and placed his paw onto my lap. It broke my heart, I fought hard to hold back my tears ...a big dog like him i thought, shouldn't be without love and lots of it.
After I got him home It took a long time for Effie to really bond with me.
My other dog Lacy really helped him to feel at home they became instant friends and with lots of love from all of us ...Effie changed both physically and mentally, me and him have an inseparable bond now wherever I am Effie wants to be there too.
Here is Effie and Lacy now http://imgur.com/a/YfhLD

That's a really nice sentiment, it's nice to know how much you loved them.
I always had newf's growing up but now that i have Effie i'd like to get another pyr.
Effie is perfect for me because he is way more active then a newf, on long walks he doesn't tire and he is more loyal then any other dog i've ever had.
Pyr's are mysteriously intelligent and observant dogs...i often like to think that Effie knows more about me then I do.

If your not damaging your life or anybody else and you take drugs...i say then that's your right to do so.
He is talking about those who are in need of help that have ruined there lives and the people around them because of there out of control drug use.
It has little to do with being different and not subscribing to social norms like top 40 pop tunes....it's about providing ways to reconnect with people and offering a better way to live then to be prosecuted just because your battling a destructive addiction.
Your only human, I have my problems too, I'm not trying to judge you.
My bad then, I really think there is a difference between those who take drugs and those who have life eroding addictions.

You make a good point....but think what we could do if only we legalized drugs....we could help them with programs to help them reintegrate back into society.
As it stands now people with these destructive addictions have no hope or love it's a vicious cycle.
I know first hand what your talking about, I lost 2 friends to hard drug use and near the end they where very difficult to be around(not trust worthy)
Not saying everyone can be saved,however, I do think with help rather than harm we could seriously make a difference.

I'm referring to addicts that are people destroying there lives with the over consumption of drugs.
Not people who take drugs.

I think he is saying that a large number of addict's stay addicted because there ostracized/shunned from reintegrating into society.
I totally think we should stop this stupid war on drugs...addict's are people with depression let's treat it as such.

Guy makes a good point, If your caught using/possessing "illegal" drugs your slapped with a criminal record.
If you get a criminal record your most likely never going to get a good job again....it's a slow death sentence.
Cosmo is beautiful.
Happy boy

I'm going to answer these one by one.
"I kept trying to use a firm voice to yell at him to get out"
I find yelling at mine will not work I use love to train my dogs EG~ sit and come, when they respond correctly are rewarded with hugs kisses,head pats. When Effie doesn't listen telling him to come will never work that will just make him extra defiant However, If i say "come here good boy" or "who's a good boy" he listens.
My thinking is letting him feel it's his own decision to come yields better results then commanding him to do so.
"Then came bath time. I couldn't get him into the bathroom because he hates it"
Well he is always going to hate it just comfort him as best you can, reassure him he is doing a good job.
"Then I had to keep him out on the balcony for about 1 hour to dry."
He didn't like the bath and now was separated from you when he was under stress....he needed you.
Take care to look at your dog and try to see what he is feeling if he is scared or bothered hold him, kiss him, tell him he is a good boy.
Take a dry towel and laet him lie on the floor inside near you. Sit next to him and dry him off, calm his nerves.
"he peed in the house"
He was under stress it's ok, practice what i said and he will see these things as not so bad next time.

He has also saved me.
There has been times I wasn't feeling well, Effie will come rest his big head on my shoulder almost as if to say "I'm here for you buddy".
I'm convinced he knows because that's the only time he does it ...I have had many dogs but nothing like him.

My guy does this thing when off the leash, he will come close when i call him but right as your going to put the leash on he darts away with a big smile on his face.
The only way i can get him to come back is to tell him he is a good boy.
Darn it, I wish I could correct that.

He kinda looks more like a Newf in this photo,however, the Great Pyrenees side is dominant right down to his triangle shaped ears,curly tail and double dew claws.
I love him too bits, Effie loves to be hugged and patted on his head.
He has a Very fluffy soft coat great to snuggle with on a cold day.
To be honest I love him more than words can express, Effie is my loyal buddy and protector and is always by my side.
His big booming bark is sure to keep all the Squirrels and neighbors cats at bay.
EDIT: After a few months of grooming him his coat is now a dark black and his white patches are now very bright. He was heart broken for a long time and would escape whenever he could, with patients,long walks and many hugs later Effie is now very happy.
When Effie is very happy he spins around it's so cute do your Pyr's do that?

WRITING.TITLE: This is my boy Effie Pyr/Newf I saved him from a kill shelter

WRITING.TEXT: The group recorded a comeback album in 1998, but Rob Pilatus died before the album was released.

What I don't get is why the mother assumed that the skater would intentionally want to hit her son...she barks out "you didn't see him" as if to infer that this skaters hobby is to skate into little boys.

rushed by aggressive offleash dogs and there's a switch that flips
That's what triggers Effie...he never will go after another dog however, If they start jumping on him he will get upset.
That said he let's my dog do anything to him.

Effie won't start a fight but if another dog decides to try him Effie will finish it and absolutely won't back down.
Effie likes non aggressive dogs and will even lay on his back pretending to give them the upper hand/paw....he seems to be extremely tolerant of dogs he likes.
On the other hand Effie is not super interested in other dogs besides a quick sniff, whilst at the dog park he usually will go off on his own.
Other things iv'e observed that are worth noting...Effie's ability to mimic behavior Eg~ My other dog when out outside on our long leash will pretend to get stuck just to coax me to come outside to play with her....somehow Effie picked up on this and adopted the same tactic.
He loves to collect shoes and doesn't chew them, he puts them around where he naps.

WRITING.TITLE: Questions about the great Pyrenees temperament.
WRITING.TEXT:
I adopted a great Pyrenees/Newf from a kill shelter named Effie.
Having had Newfoundland's before i believe Effie exhibits behavior more from his great Pyrenees side.
Effie unlike a Newf will not back down from a fight EG~ At the dog park if a dog try's to challenge him he will not stop until that dog gives up or is inured.(it's actually very scary)
On the other hand Effie is very very sweet and loyal to me, I trust him and i know he would never hurt me, my wife or my other dog.
Effie is very protective of our property, if he see's or even smells the scent of another animal he let's out the deepest scariest bark I've ever heard.
Effie likes to sleep in neutral locations in the house so he can hear both the front and back door incase of intruders.
Outside Effie likes to wonder and won't listen when you call him, he stays about a half football field away and only comes back when your near the car or home.
Overall Effie is a sweet and loyal guy who really loves to be loved my only concern is when he flips the switch when he feels threatened ....it's scary.
Are these traits to expect in a great Pyrenees?

My best moment in gaming was when i beat Metal Gear for the Nes.
I did it by generating save codes until I managed to create one that got me to the end of the game.
I spent more time cracking codes then I actually played the game.

WRITING.TITLE: Textbook quality as these guys jack a large pine.

WRITING.TEXT:
Not my cup of tea,however, this has been professionally produced from what I heard.
So yea it sounds clean and your voice is good.
My only problem with it is ...it sounds like at-least a dozen or so artists doing the same thing.
I think you have the Talent to do broader material, perhaps work with a different producer.
Overall it sounds professional.
